item.title: Django, Nginx, WSGI and encoded slashes
item.description: Problem You are serving a Django application using Nginx to proxy to an Apache server running mod_wsgi and you want to allow slashes in your URL keywords. For example, you may want to edit some attribute of the page at URL /; hence, you want to use a URL regex of the form: url(r'/edit/page/(?P<page_url>.*)/$', ...) and use the URL /edit/page/%2F/ to edit this page, where the third path segment is URL-encoded.
